com.smartnsoft.droid4me.widget
Class SmartImageView

java.lang.Object
  android.view.View
      android.widget.ImageView
          com.smartnsoft.droid4me.widget.SmartImageView
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback
public class SmartImageView
extends android.widget.ImageView

Enables to receive an event when the ImageView size has changed, set an automatic ratio between its width and its height, and discard the layout requests.

This is especially useful when an image width is set to a specific width policy and that the height should be set accordingly.

Since:
2010.02.27
Author:
É‰douard Mercier

Method Detail

getRatio

public float getRatio()

setRatio

public void setRatio(float ratio)
Sets the ratio between the height and the width of the image. The default value is 9 / 16.

Parameters:
ratio - when set to -1, no ratio is applied

isFixedSized

public boolean isFixedSized()
The default value of the underlying flag is false.

Returns:
true if and only if the requestLayout() should do nothing
See Also:
setFixedSized(boolean)

setFixedSized

public void setFixedSized(boolean fixedSized)
Indicates that the underlying ImageView Drawable size never changes, and hence causing the requestLayout() to do nothing (not invoking the parent method).

This feature is especially useful used in combination with the Gallery widget, which causes flickering issues when updating the widgets inside a ViewGroup.

Parameters:
fixedSized - when set to true, the requestLayout() will not invoke its parent method, and hence will do nothing

public final OnSizeChangedListener<SmartImageView> getOnSizeChangedListener()

Indicates the interface to trigger when the image view size has changed.
